metadata.feature_description: Provides advanced search capabilities for files and folders with sorting, filtering, and pagination

steps.action: Navigate to Assets panel and enter search term 'cavalier' in search box
steps.expected: Files containing 'cavalier' in their name should appear in search results
steps.actual: Search results showed 2 files: cavalier-tv.png and cavalier-tv-thumb-120.png with search term highlighted in yellow

steps.action: Enter folder name 'Templates' in search box and press Enter
steps.expected: Folders containing 'Templates' should appear in search results
steps.actual: Search produced no results. The search feature only searches files, not folders (labeled as 'Search Files' in the UI)

issues: Search functionality does not search folder names, only file names. This may be by design as the search box is labeled 'Search Files'.

steps.action: Enter partial search term 'test_' in search box and press Enter
steps.expected: All files containing 'test_' should appear in search results
steps.actual: Search results showed multiple files including test_image.jpg, test_image.png, test_image2.png, test_image3.png, test_image-thumb-154.png, test_image-thumb-156.jpg, test_upload_image.png, version_test.txt, workflow_test_file.txt with search term highlighted

steps.action: Click on sort dropdown and select 'Alphabetical' option
steps.expected: Items should be sorted alphabetically A-Z with folders first, then files
steps.actual: Items sorted correctly: folders first (Badges, Groups, Images, RenamedSecureFolder, Templates, Users) then files alphabetically (cavalier-logo.png, Dnn.CKEditorSettings.xml, etc.)

steps.action: Click on sort dropdown and select 'Last Modified' option
steps.expected: Items should be sorted by last modification date
steps.actual: Items reordered with most recently modified items first (Templates folder appeared first)

steps.action: Click on sort dropdown and select 'Date Uploaded' option
steps.expected: Items should be sorted by upload date
steps.actual: Items reordered based on upload date (Images folder appeared first)

steps.action: Navigate to Images folder with many items and check for pagination controls
steps.expected: Items should be displayed with pagination or infinite scroll for large datasets
steps.actual: All 24 items (3 folders + 21 files) loaded without traditional pagination controls. The system uses scrolling/infinite loading rather than numbered pages.

steps.action: Enter search term 'special chars' to find files with special characters in name
steps.expected: Files containing the search terms should appear regardless of special characters in their names
steps.actual: Search found 'test_special_!@#chars.txt' file with search terms 'special' and 'chars' highlighted in yellow

steps.action: Navigate from Home to Images to Publisher subfolder
steps.expected: Breadcrumb should show full path and folder contents should update
steps.actual: Successfully navigated through hierarchy. Breadcrumb showed 'HOME > IMAGES > PUBLISHER' and folder contents updated correctly

steps.action: Click on 'Images' in breadcrumb to navigate back up
steps.expected: Should navigate back to Images folder
steps.actual: Successfully navigated back to Images folder via breadcrumb click

steps.expected: Should display appropriate message when no results found
steps.actual: Displayed clear message 'Your Search Produced No Results' with a search icon

observations: The search functionality is labeled 'Search Files' and only searches file names, not folder names. This appears to be by design.
No explicit Z-A (reverse alphabetical) sort option exists - only Alphabetical (A-Z), Last Modified, and Date Uploaded are available.
No explicit 'Sort by Size' option exists in the UI, though this was mentioned in suggested test scenarios.
The Assets panel uses continuous loading rather than traditional numbered pagination for displaying items.
Search results highlight matching text in yellow for easy identification.
Folders are always displayed before files regardless of sort order selected.
The folder dropdown shows the current folder name while breadcrumbs show the full navigation path.
